_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The four kinds of self-assurance of a Re: No one can scold him for not understanding things
No one can scold him for not having ended all defilements
No one can scold him for teaching that certain acts are obstructions
No one can scold him for teaching that his teachings lead to the complete ending of suffering
The various grounds for criticism that v: The various grounds for criticism that ascetics and brahmins rely on vanish on reaching a Realized One
The qualities of a Realized One (a causa: Roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies
Rolls forth the Wheel of Dhamma as a consummate one
Sentient beings revere him, first among gods and humans, who has gone beyond rebirth.
